key_issues: Exclusion of income covered under section 80B from total income as defined under section 2(24) of the Income-tax Ordinance, 1979.
Application of tax relief under Part III of Second Schedule to the Income-tax Ordinance, 1979.

arguments.department: The learned C.I.T.(A) was not justified to exclude income covered under section 80B from total income.
arguments.assessee: Income covered under section 80B falls within the presumptive tax regime and should not be included in total income for tax relief computation.

decision: The learned C.I.T.(A) correctly directed the exclusion of income covered under section 80B for tax relief computation under Part III of Second Schedule to the Income-tax Ordinance, 1979.
